abstract: Number of Indian students studying in United States is surging as competition for admission to top Indian institutions has made that goal nearly unattainable; with about half of India's 1.2 billion people under age of 25, and ranks of middle class swelling, country's handful of highly selective universities are overwhelmed; some students say greater intellectual freedom of American education is also a draw.
snippet: The number of Indian students studying in the United States is surging as competition for admission to top Indian institutions has made that goal nearly unattainable.
lead_paragraph: The number of Indian students studying in the United States is surging as competition for admission to top Indian institutions has made that goal nearly unattainable.

headline.main: Squeezed Out in India, Students Turn to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Squeezed Out in India, Students Turn to U.S.
headline.seo: Squeezed Out in India, Students Turn to United States
